description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Palma de Mallorca" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Palma de Mallorca

places.generalDescription: Palma Aquarium, located near the airport and opened in 2007, boasts the largest live coral collection in Europe. The aquarium features over 700 types of creatures, including impressive sand tiger sharks in the 'Big Blue' tank with three million liters of water. With more than 55 aquariums and 8000 fish from around the world, it offers an ideal family day out.

sources.snippet: For those interested in culture, a visit to the Palma Aquarium is a must. Marvel at the fascinating sea creatures and learn more about the underwater world. A romantic carriage ride through the old town of Palma will enchant you with its charm and historic atmosphere.
sources.shortName: Activities for couples Palma de Mallorca 2025

places.name: Palma Aquarium

reviews.text: We went there after lunch. It has a lot of different species to see, and it's divided into different areas. The jungle area was quite interesting since you have a feeling you are in South America. There are additional options for exploring the park, but we didn't do it (as it was charged additionally). There is also a cafe for refreshment. There wasn't a queue at the entrance, but we bought our tickets a day in advance, via online (there was a discount available). This can be a good family day if you are going with kids. There are also playgrounds inside the park. I would recommend it!

Wow, what an amazing visit we had! I was expecting this to be a short 45-minute visit with just enough to see. It turned out to be a full experience lasting a few hours! The whole story is developing nicely, and there are plenty of species to see and learn about. I enjoyed the Jungle the most, as it was an outside adventure and looked amazing! I recommend this as a must-see in Palma!

Great experience overall! The Palma Aquarium offers a wide variety of marine life and beautifully designed tanks. The big shark tank is truly impressive. It's a bit pricey, but worth it for families and ocean lovers. Staff were friendly, and everything was clean and well-maintained. Could use more interactive exhibits, but still a great visit. I'd definitely recommend it if you're in the area.

places.address: Carrer de Manuela de los Herreros, 21, Platja de Palma, 07610 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

places.generalDescription: Castell de Bellver, a 14th-century circular castle commissioned by James II of Aragon, sits atop a wooded hill overlooking Palma. Initially built as a royal residence, it later served as a military prison. Today, the castle houses the City History Museum showcasing Mallorca's history through various artifacts and exhibits. Visitors can enjoy panoramic views of Palma and its bay from the top of the castle while surrounded by fragrant pine woods.

sources.snippet: For those interested in culture, Palma de Mallorca offers impressive sights such as the Gothic cathedral La Seu or the Castell de Bellver. Stroll through the charming alleyways of the old town and let yourself be enchanted by the romantic atmosphere. Palma de Mallorca has the perfect adventure for every couple - let yourself be inspired and make unforgettable memories!
sources.shortName: Activities for couples Palma de Mallorca 2025

sources.snippet: Another nice thing to do, around lunch time, is to drift over to the Mercat de Santa Catalina. A great local market you can pick up some picnic supplies from the array of vendors or stop for some tapas and other quick bites from some of the bars. The surrounding streets also have a range of restaurants, including some that are more modern in style.
sources.shortName: Romantic Mini-Guide to Mallorca, the Island of Love

places.name: Castell de Bellver

reviews.text:
The castle is visible from many places in the city. We purchased the castle entrance tickets as part of the City sightseeing bus tour. Collect your ticket at the window by showing your receipt.

You can easily take the stairs. If you prefer to access the ramp entrance, it is further along the roadway. It's steep and a bit of incline.

Look for a kiosk sign with an I. It has a map in Spanish but easy to follow. The map is pertinent to the bottom floor of the castle. Lots of storyboards in  multiple languages, including English.

There's also a historical timetable of the city that is equally interesting, along with maps.

Washrooms are available throughout that are quite clean. Be sure to bring water as it can very warm walking the multiple floors. FYI- no place to sit where the sun is out, so come prepared!

Highly recommend a visit to the castle!

The place itself is stunning, but unfortunately, it's not open to visitors from the inside. It's located at the top of a hill, so if you're coming by bus, you'll have to climb the stairs. It's almost like a little hike! Each step you take brings you closer to the fort, and you'll get a breathtaking view of the sea and the city from the top. There are plenty of sitting benches available to rest, grab a snack, or take some amazing photos. It would have been so much better if we could have entered the fort, but it's still a beautiful place to visit.

Bellver Castle is a truly impressive sight. We arrived a bit late and missed the chance to go inside (it closes at 7pm in the summer), but even from the outside, the circular Gothic architecture is stunning.

The real highlight, though, is the location. Situated on a hilltop, the castle offers an absolutely breathtaking panoramic view of Palma and its bay. It's the perfect spot to capture some incredible photos and just take in the beauty of the area. It's worth the trip up the hill just for the views alone.

places.address: Carrer Camilo José Cela, s/n, Ponent, 07014 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Royal Palace of La Almudaina, a stunning blend of history and architecture, is located in Palma, right next to the iconic cathedral. Originally an Arabian fort, it was transformed into a royal residence by King Jaume after the Christian conquest in 1229. This magnificent palace serves as one of the official residences for the Spanish royal family and showcases various areas open to visitors.

sources.snippet: You may like to go inside some of its top historic sites like the Cathedral, the Royal Palace of La Almudaina, the Fundación Bartolomé March, a historic mansion turn modern art museum (somewhat limited collection, but lovely building and views!). Do was wandering on the streets south of the Cathedral, where you can also find the Banys Arabs, the remains of the Arab Baths. One of the most romantic places in Palma, there’s also a pretty garden where you can take a break.
sources.shortName: Romantic Mini-Guide to Mallorca, the Island of Love

places.name: Royal Palace of La Almudaina

reviews.text: It was worth a visit, if you go therr i recommend using an audio guide because it definitely makes the visit better, we didn't take it but if i would go again i would. If you are an EU citizen you can also go there between some hours that are listed at the entrance to get a free ticket. I suggest you look into it before you go, so you don't have to pay for the ticket. Otherwise it was very pretty the view is amazing and the palace is really interesting. We just walked around the place and we needed 45 minutes so i think it would take longer if we had an audio guide.

The building itself and architecture is of course stunning, but the rooms are pretty much empty with only a few tapestries and cabinets on display and no information provided about them. We weren't aware until after our visit that an audio guide is available so perhaps this information is in that guide. The star I deducted was for the attitude of the staff. I felt like it was a chore for the girl at the desk to even sell us the tickets and the 2 security men that put our belongings through the xray machine looked like they were sucking lemons and couldn't care less.

Absolutely stunning place! The Royal Palace of La Almudaina is full of medieval charm and history. The architecture is impressive, with beautiful stone halls, grand rooms, and amazing views of the sea from the upper levels. It feels like stepping back in time. Everything is well preserved and the atmosphere is truly majestic. A must-visit in Palma for history and architecture lovers!

places.address: Carrer del Palau Reial, s/n, Centre, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the affluent Son Vida neighborhood, Castillo Hotel Son Vida is a luxurious retreat housed in a 13th-century castle with stunning views of Palma Bay. The hotel boasts a renovated spa offering various treatments and three swimming pools, including an indoor one. With 164 rooms and suites, including the iconic LOEWE suite designed by Enrique Loewe, guests can immerse themselves in lavish accommodations.

sources.snippet: 13th-century palace turned luxury hotel, in the hills outside Palma. Elegant Spanish decor, spacious rooms and stunning views. Plenty to keep all entertained including spa, swimming pools, extensive grounds and a number of dining and bar options.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Palma de Mallorca, Spain (2025)

places.name: Castillo Hotel Son Vida

reviews.text:
My husband and I stayed one night while in Mallorca. This is a very beautiful hotel with a limited age to stay.
It was less than 30 minute cab ride from the airport.
It is in a wonderful natural setting with many golf courses around.
We had booked a king room with a bay view and the view from the room was fantastic.
The amenities were diptyque.
The hotel pool was lovely, although it was still a bit chilly so we didn't get in the pool.
The view from the bar area is also very beautiful and perfect for relaxing. Great food in the restaurant as well.
I would like to stay longer next time.
By the way, we were not, but many of the people staying there were European.

I am just increasing the overall score a bit for one reason only is the staff of the hotel primarily, concierge team, Bell men very respectful and helpful, Resturant at breakfast very nice and friendly teams at least that were serving us during our stay, housekeeping team and the lady who answers every morning at the operator. This team made it special.

But the awkward part of this customer experience journey which is the reception and their management Which are the front liners of any hotel which needs to ensure a smooth journey were not friendly, very abrupt and their management got have solved the issue in a very nice way yet they mad it a very negative experience yet since I am coming for a vacation so didn't let their negative energy impact my stay. Yet I know that I am not going to stay at this property again or recommend it to others.

I have stayed at this hotel on Mallorca several times, attracted by its location near Palma and its golf facilities. However, this stay was extremely disappointing.

The receptionist was rude and completely inattentive. No information about the hotel or my loyalty benefits was provided. Instead, I was given a room without a view, even though better rooms were clearly available on the hotel's own website. This is unacceptable and shows a lack of respect for returning guests.

Breakfast was another unpleasant experience – chaotic, disorganized, and painfully slow. It felt more like a cheap cafeteria than a five-star property.

Overall, what could have been another enjoyable stay was ruined by poor service and unprofessional staff. For a hotel that positions itself as a premium destination, such treatment is simply inexcusable.

places.address: Carrer Raixa, 2, Urbanizacion, Ponent, 07013 Son Vida, Illes Balears, Spain

places.generalDescription: Mercat de Santa Catalina is a must-visit undercover food market in the trendy Santa Catalina neighborhood. It's recommended to explore it after sunset, as the area comes alive with its thriving nightlife, featuring trendy bars, clubs, and contemporary restaurants. The market offers a variety of local delicacies such as sobrassada sausage, olive oil, meats, cheeses, wines, and liqueurs. You can also find stalls selling oils, chutneys, honey, and other packaged goods.

sources.snippet: In the morning, you can visit the local market Mercat de Santa Catalina, walk the streets to soak up the funky atmosphere, browse the boutiques in search of quirky souvenirs and stop for lunch-683058) at trendy Santa, and bar hop along Calle Sant Magi for some of Palma's best cocktails to top off a perfect bohemian city break. We even hear that Santa Catalina is a great place for people watching...
sources.shortName: Fun for two in Mallorca

sources.snippet: Another nice thing to do, around lunch time, is to drift over to the Mercat de Santa Catalina. A great local market you can pick up some picnic supplies from the array of vendors or stop for some tapas and other quick bites from some of the bars. The surrounding streets also have a range of restaurants, including some that are more modern in style.
sources.shortName: Romantic Mini-Guide to Mallorca, the Island of Love

sources.snippet: This colourful barrio is known for its trendy shops and dining spots and is home to the Mercat de Santa Catalina, Mallorca’s oldest food market.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Mallorca ~ The Good Life Awaits

places.name: Mercat de Santa Catalina

reviews.text: Lovely local market surrounded by coffee shops. Great place to browse and eat

Most of it is not working in the morning, later on the diversion is not as great, as far as food goes, some places make and some just warm up things, however most don't bother adding prices. It is generally for the local folk and not so touristy-welcoming. Can't say I liked it. Didn't find anything to appeal for me, and came in twice. Didn't even get pictures inside, as there was nothing to take a picture of....
We bought a few delicacies from here like dried spices, fruits and the rotisserie chicken. All delicious. We indulged the bought items by the park close by, under the trees on a sunny day. Bliss.

places.address: Plaça de la Navegació, s/n, Ponent, 07013 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

places.generalDescription: Caló del Moro is a hidden gem nestled in a picturesque cove on the southeast coast of Mallorca, near Sant Antoni de Portmany. This enchanting beach boasts soft golden sands and stunningly clear turquoise waters that create an inviting atmosphere for sunbathers and swimmers alike. The rugged coastline surrounding Caló del Moro adds to its charm, making it feel like a slice of paradise. Accessible only by foot through lush pine trees, this secluded spot offers breathtaking sunset views that are perfect for capturing unforgettable moments.
places.name: Caló del Moro

reviews.text:
It is a really beautiful place. I am glad that I went. I was very impressed.
I thought it was still a little chilly for swimming at the beginning of April, but I wanted to jump in.
We took a cab from Palma to get here, but I would recommend renting a car. It took over an hour each way by cab and cost us a fortune. Also, there were no cabs at all to take us back, which was very annoying.
Be sure to rent a car, or if you take a cab, have it wait for you until you return.

Okay, this place is NEXT LEVEL. The view is so mountainy and steep (kinda feels like a hike to get there, but worth every step). The water? Insane!! Super clear, warm, and that perfect turquoise you see in Pinterest pics. The sand is soft and super nice. There are even little fish swimming around in the shallow part, they might nibble your toes (low-key funny but also cute). Honestly, probably the most stunning beach on the island.

It is def beautiful but like some others say, it's a lot to get there. Walking for 15min from the car parking in the heat was not fun at all, bringing hiking shoes just to go to the beach because it's rocky was a hassle, the beach itself is tiny.. the water is pretty but not worth all the effort imo… we took photos and left quickly. There are many other easy access beaches around the island, I'd rather go somewhere else with less stress.

places.address: 07650 Sant Antoni de Portmany, Balearic Islands, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled in a charming, buttery-hued mansion surrounded by lush palm trees, Fera Palma Restaurant is a hidden gem that artfully blends Mediterranean and Asian flavors. This stylish venue invites diners to indulge in the creative culinary masterpieces of Austrian chef Simon Petutschnig. Among the standout dishes is the breathtaking Sea in a Shell, featuring oysters paired with Japanese yuzu and island plankton that releases steam reminiscent of ocean mist when hot water is poured over it.

sources.snippet: Most if not all of the rooms offer spectacular sea views of Palma Bay, while some also boast views of the old town. Waking up here in our huge bed and grabbing a coffee from the Nespresso machine to sip on the balcony was pure, unadulterated bliss.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Mallorca ~ The Good Life Awaits

places.name: Fera Palma Restaurant

reviews.text: The food is simply amazing, good portions (we went for the 7 courses), each dish was a real delight. Service was undoubtedly the highlight of our experience, from the waiters to the sommelier, we were served with a lot of care and a big smile! Full vegetarian menu available, which was equally amazing as the normal menu.

This place had so many recommendations so I decided to try it out but left with huge disappointment.
To start off, my table seating was out of place. Near the service area, waiters rushing in/out near me. It was unbelievably hot. And I am general on the cool side feeling always cold. I asked for table change but there weren't any. To give you an idea about how hot it was, ice melted in my glass within minutes. One of the waitresses was kind enough to open nearby window so some breeze can come in..

The restaurant has several dining areas, one of them is the picture perfect courtyard, the rest do not have the same ambiance. I was disappointed about seating choice but nevertheless decided to go ahead and try the menu ..

I'm genuinely shocked to read all the reviews here ! Wondering if my day was a fluke and just bad day for the kitchen. As it was really busy.
I went with the 4 course tasting menu:

To start off, the presentation is actually lovely and superb but the taste was not there..
The appetizers were too salty with nothing special to remember. You can't taste the various elements in a dish. The bread was something you can easily make at home..I actually wanted to leave at that point…

Now the main course, seabass was actually good and I really enjoyed the dish, but I generally think sea bass is a good fish to cook with, you can never go wrong with it. It also goes well with a lot of elements ..
The wagyu beef was poorly done. I did like the idea of truffle churros and sides. The sauces are actually poorly made. Too salty and at beginners level.
I do believe the pastry chef saved the day, the dessert was really good, hence the three star. I am not a dessert person so if something wows me then it's legit..

People in comments wondering about Michelin star. The restaurant needs to be consistent to receive any form of designation. It was a busy night, I get it. But if staff feel overwhelmed to serve a large number maybe cut down on the number of tables to serve better quality.

Overall I wish the owner all the best but there are several key factors to be attended to. This is not what I expected considering the prices and reviews ..

My husband and I had a lovely dinner here. From the moment we walked in it was a great experience. We loved the wine pairing with local wines. We opted for the 4 course tasting and loved every bite. I will definitely be recommending this restaurant to anyone coming to Palma

places.address: C/ de la Concepció, 4, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

places.generalDescription: Sa Bodegueta is a fantastic restaurant with great food and wine at reasonable prices. The owner is very welcoming, and the atmosphere is authentic and charming. You will not be disappointed if you visit this place!

sources.snippet: Tea and cake is also a pleasure at Mariola's Bakery, while Sa Bodegueta, also famed for delicious desserts offers a full lunch and supper menu as well. For gelato-lovers, head to Gelateria Pomono and try out their great variety of artisan ice cream and frozen yoghurt.
sources.shortName: Passion in Palma, romantic hotspots for Valentine's Day

places.name: Sa Bodegueta

reviews.text: Incredible food and extremely friendly service. We were seated almost before closing and our food order was put through. Furthermore, one-person paella was accommodated and it came out so deliciously. The other dish we tried was the sea bass, which was filled with flavour and fresh as if just caught! The meal was finished off with shots of the local herbal liqueur. 5 stars hands down unequivocally.

Family owned, SUPER quaint, absolutely fantastic food and great presentation.  Owner sitter pleasant and chef was very attentive.  Best Olive Oil we've tasted in Europe and it comes from the Region where the owners are from.  Really wish we could have tried the homemade desserts, but we were too full..... Oh. And the Sangria!!

A beautiful little restaurant, tucked into an alleyway next to a church. The food was excellent, the service charming and swift and the menu was varied. Caution: The tapas are quite big, each one about the size of a conventional main course. The waiter was kind enough to cancel some orders as we realized that we would never be able to finish our meals.

Small suggestion: Improving ventilation in the restaurant might elevate the dining experience even more and encourage diners to have more food, as you tend to feel full quickly on hot summer days.

places.address: C/ del Sant Crist, 2, Distrito Centro, 07001 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

places.generalDescription: Parc de la Mar is a tranquil and beautiful hangout in Palma, featuring tree-lined paths, benches, and a lagoon. It's known for its proximity to the grand Gothic cathedral of Mallorca, offering visitors the chance to admire its lofty ceilings and intricate Gaudi work. The park also houses a charming playground with three climbing frames, including one resembling a castle tower.

sources.snippet: Go inside if you have time, although I’d argue that the best views can be enjoyed from the palm-filled Parc de la Mar that you will find to the front of the building.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Mallorca ~ The Good Life Awaits

places.name: Parc de la Mar

reviews.text:
Not really a park, but rather a huge square between the cathedral and the coastline.

There is a artificial lake, which intensifies the beauty of the cathedral, as it reflects to the lake.

Amazing views, both to the cathedral and towards the sea. Great place to enjoy the scenery, stroll around or enjoy a drink or snack in the bars in the area.

Giant plaza, not a park in the meaning of nature. There are palmas, yes, there is a lake, yes, everything is very pretty and all, but it's cement. Very nice to walk around, quite busy at weekends, quite empty in a weekday in January. A few things to do, more objects to explore and take a picture of. I recommend you make a round of it both under and on the top line.

Parc de la Mar is my go-to place to watch the sunset in Palma. It's also great for picnics, jogging, and walking. Running in a circuit around the park almost perfectly completes one mile. Rain or shine it's worth seeing! The cathedral view, old wall features, and beautiful view of the sunset make this a go-to. 😊

places.address: 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

places.generalDescription: Passeig del Born is a renowned street in the heart of the historic center, featuring modernist buildings, statues, and upscale shops. It's conveniently close to La Almudaina palace and offers a delightful ambiance with its tree-lined walkway. The area is a shopping haven, hosting an array of designer stores like Zara, Stradivarius, Massimo Dutti, Max Mara, and Louis Vuitton.

sources.snippet: Stroll down the leafy Passeig del Born and be sure to drop a few euros on Carrer de Sant Miquel if retail therapy is your thing.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Mallorca ~ The Good Life Awaits

places.name: Pg. del Born

reviews.text: Very nice street, beautiful buildings and fountains
Beautiful street, one of the nicest I have seen
one of the most elegant and iconic boulevards, lined with majestic trees, luxury boutiques, cafes, and historic buildings.

places.address: Centre, 07012 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Sheraton Mallorca Arabella Golf Hotel is a luxurious Mediterranean-style hotel offering refined rooms and suites, some with private balconies. The hotel features a spa with a Turkish bath, treatment room, and Jacuzzi for ultimate relaxation. Guests can enjoy European dining at the on-site restaurant and take advantage of the fitness center, two outdoor pools, and kids club. The hotel's strategic location provides easy access to attractions such as Castell de Bellver Castle and Catedral de Mallorca.

sources.snippet: A resort with all the charm of a Spanish country house, in the hills outside Palma de Mallorca. Plenty of in house activities including swimming pools, restaurants and a lovely spa. Comfortable and spacious rooms and suites.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Palma de Mallorca, Spain (2025)

places.name: Sheraton Mallorca Arabella Golf Hotel

reviews.text: Great experience overall. We had two rooms, one was upgraded and they also accommodated our late checkout request which was great. It is a good location for visiting Palma and exploring Valldemossa and Soller area. Only feedback for improvement would be the breakfast selection (which was better in our previous hotel in Mallorca) and also the service at breakfast area was somehow poorer than the rest of the hotel. Beautiful hotel overall, we especially liked the gardens and the outdoor pool.

Overall good but a couple of places where we felt a bit let down.

- Beautiful building and pool area. Clean.
- Staff generally friendly and helpful.
- Food is generally alright. Breakfast buffet is decent but not amazing. Food needs to be replenished faster, and staff should check plates etc. are clean - one of the buffet plates I picked up had an egg stain on the back of it.
- Great to have access to tennis courts and golf.
- Rooms are nice and a decent size.
- Unfortunately, the kitchen served a chicken burger to my partner that was raw in the centre - never acceptable, esp at 5 star hotel.
- A member of front desk staff seemed to find it amusing that the taxi we had asked to be booked had just been forgotten about. Was a bit odd.
- I also am still unable to understand why the hotel charges 10 Euros for each 1L bottle of water (more than beer and wine). Think that is a bit cheeky when you are advised to avoid tap water. Pricing in general is quite high for poolside food and drinks.

Here's my honest review of Sheraton.

Overall, I had a decent stay, but it didn't live up to what I'd expect from a five-star hotel.

When we arrived, no one helped us with our luggage-which was disappointing. For a hotel of this level, that kind of service should be automatic. We had to handle it ourselves until someone finally noticed. Check-in was smooth and efficient, though, which I appreciated.

My room had a beautiful view and was mostly clean, but one major issue really affected my experience: a part of the shower fell off, and an insect came out of it. I was really scared and tried calling reception, but no one picked up. I even pressed the emergency button and still got no answer. That kind of response-especially in a situation that felt urgent-is completely unacceptable at this level.

The pool was nice, but the spa was underwhelming. It didn't feel very clean, and my mom had a massage that was just average despite being quite expensive.

We also ate at the hotel restaurant. The food itself was good, but the service was just okay-nothing memorable or impressive.

The concierge is connected to the reception, which felt a bit unusual, but they did give us some helpful recommendations. One nice gesture was that they allowed us to check out late, which we appreciated.

In short, this hotel has potential and some nice aspects, but the overall experience felt like it fell short of true five-star hospitality. I wasn't impressed by the service and wouldn't consider it worth the price.

places.address: Carrer Vinagrella, Poniente, 07013 Son Vida, Balearic Islands, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Palma, Bodega Ca'n Rigo is a charming tapas bar that exudes an authentic Spanish vibe. This quaint establishment features a rustic wine cellar ambiance, perfect for those seeking traditional flavors and local wines. With its cozy layout spread across two levels, it offers an intimate setting to savor classic dishes like Tortilla Española and homemade Albondigas. The delightful atmosphere is enhanced by tasteful decor, making it an ideal spot for both casual dining and romantic evenings.

sources.snippet: Some of the best tapas (and ambiance) in town can be Bar España or for a more romantic atmosphere, seek out Bodega Can Rigo, which also has some exceptional local wines and food items. If you want to get a little off the beaten track, then make your way to the Plaça Llorenç Bisbal, a pretty square flanked by the medieval Nuestra Señora del Socorro church and home to the local hangout Bar Rita. Alternatively, if you’re looking for a more sophisticated romantic meal, book a table at the Can Cera Gastro-Bar, where you can sample gastronomic tapas in the gorgeous setting of the courtyard of a historic mansion (see more in the hotel section below or here).
sources.shortName: Romantic Mini-Guide to Mallorca, the Island of Love

places.name: Bodega Ca'n Rigo

reviews.text: Super cute restaurant with amazing food. Probably one of the best tapas I had. And the atmosphere was super nice :) can definitely recommend this place!

I think this one was over-rated. The bar itself was beautifully decorated with great atmosphere. The staff was okay. However the tapas unfortunately surprised us.

We ordered 4 tapas. Since we sat at the upper floor with a great view over the bar. We could see that most of the food was not cooked by the bar but directly taken from the ready-to-eat packs which could be bought from Supermarket, including the octopus (which was charged at €16), the shrimps, etc. They just heated them up and add olive oil and salt. 😢

I understand that it's a bar not a restaurant. However my experience told me that a lot of other bars would cook and prepare their food in advance but not directly using supermarket ready-to-eat food.

I won't recommend this one to my friends.
Great cozy bar with amazing atmosphere and very kind staff! Tapas are tasty and great fit with local wine (ask for the “wine offer of the week). Highly recommended!

places.address: Carrer de Sant Feliu, 16, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

places.generalDescription: Adrian Quetglas Restaurant in Palma is a favorite among the city's chic food enthusiasts. Owned by Michelin-starred chef Adrian Quetglas, this Mediterranean dining room offers an intimate atmosphere and innovative flavors in its modern dishes. The restaurant features a lunchtime tasting menu and evening options that include unique dishes like Iberian ham with marinated papaya, orzo with squid and yuzu, and Mallorquin ensaimada with matcha tea and chocolate for dessert.

sources.snippet: Award-winning restaurant Adrian Quetglas, is also proudly declaring its belief in love with a gastronomic treat on Sunday 14th February. Their 7 course tasting menu, which sets off how it means to go on, with Guillardeau oysters with horseradish and a salad of apples and pears, will have your mouthwatering before you've finished reading the menu (65€ food, 35€ drinks). Again, a reservation is essential!
sources.shortName: Passion in Palma, romantic hotspots for Valentine's Day

places.name: Adrian Quetglas Restaurant

reviews.text: The place is lovely and the service is excellent. We went for dinner for the eight course menu. I would say my favorite are the first four courses and then the last two. The Caesar tacos were amazing, probably my favorite. The mushroom consome was delicious as well! The last two courses were the dessert offerings and they were absolutely delicious. I didn't care for the two main courses in the middle of the meal but overall it was a great experience!

The restaurant and service is great. I enjoyed the first three plates on the lunch menu. The combination of flavors complemented each other very well. Although, I didn't enjoy the watercress muslin and sauce of the poulard. I thought the sauce was too sweet and the muslin didn't go well with the poulard. The dessert was a little too sweet for my taste. It was a good experience and good price, therefore I will return.

The restaurant is outside of the more touristy part of Palma.

We had the tasting menu and wine pairing which was great value. We had a late lunch and were the last serving; it felt a little bit rushed but the staff were charming and helpful and the food was delicious.

places.address: Pg. de Mallorca, 20, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

places.generalDescription: Hotel Can Cera is a refined property that offers a bar, restaurant, and breakfast, as well as a spa, sauna, and lounge. The hotel welcomes guests with a traditional Majorcan patio featuring magnificent arches and lush plants. It has been renovated but still retains many original features from its past as a family home. The hotel boasts various common spaces including meeting rooms, an intimate salon, a reading room, and a top-floor terrace with views over the old city rooftops.

sources.snippet: Traditional elegant interiors boast antique furnishings, art works, and sophisticated style. Large romantic rooms and suites have private balconies. Fantastic restaurant and stunning views from the roof top terrace.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Palma de Mallorca, Spain (2025)

sources.snippet: The historic Luxury Hotel Can Cera, over 700 years old, combines old-world charm with modern luxury. It offers 12 spacious rooms, modern amenities, a Gastrobar, and excellent service.
sources.shortName: Handpicked boutique hotels Palma de Mallorca luxury hotels and apartments

places.name: Hotel Can Cera

reviews.text: Incredible stay! One of the best hotels I've ever been to. The consideration and experience for guests is truly remarkable. They have a private spa that you can rent out. Wonderful rooms and the location in the city center is convenient for walking anywhere. Thank you Benjamin and all the wonderful people at Can Cera. I look forward to coming back!

My husband and I had a wonderful stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend it to others visiting Palma. We booked it for the fantastic location, beautiful property, and generously spacious rooms-and it truly lived up to our expectations.

The staff made our experience even more memorable. Everyone was warm, friendly, and genuinely welcoming. They also gave us great local recommendations for dining and things to do. A special thank you to Giulia, who was especially kind and helpful during our departure-she even helped us book a taxi, which we really appreciated.

One helpful note for future guests: if you're arriving by car or renting a car, be aware that parking is not directly onsite (which is common in central Palma). The closest parking lot is about a 10-minute walk away. We were able to drop off our luggage first and the staff kindly assisted with directions and bags, but understanding this in advance would have helped us plan better.

Overall, it was a lovely stay in a charming city, and we'd happily return!

Had an amazing stay at Can Cera. Location was perfectly walkable to all the shops and restaurants. Room was peaceful with comfy beds and an amazing shower and separate bath tub. Everyone was kind and helpful. I would recommend getting breakfast here as it was amazing as well.

places.address: Carrer de Sant Francesc, 8, Distrito Centro, 07001 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

places.generalDescription: A Ma Maison Restaurant, located in Santa Catalina, is a charming and intimate spot with a cozy atmosphere. The menu offers a variety of North African dishes with vegan options available. The restaurant recently celebrated its 9th anniversary and is known for its innovative chef Saloua, who cooks with passion and ensures a personalized experience for guests. A Ma Maison also offers special tasting menus for occasions like Valentine's Day, showcasing flavorful delights such as red tuna tartare.

sources.snippet: French Tunisian restaurant A Ma Maison, based in Santa Catalina, is particularly excited about Valentines and has prepared a special tasting menu (48.50€) for Saturday 13th February, which includes among other flavoursome delights a dish of aphrodisiacal red tuna tartare. An intimate venue, booking in advance is essential. Award-winning restaurant Adrian Quetglas, is also proudly declaring its belief in love with a gastronomic treat on Sunday 14th February.
sources.shortName: Passion in Palma, romantic hotspots for Valentine's Day

places.name: A Ma Maison Restaurant

reviews.text:
Saloua, our chef, server, sommelier and friend by the end of the night was absolutely fantastic. This intimate family restaurant makes you feel a part of the family immediately and Saloua serves such amazing, distinctive and authentic foods. So many new flavour combinations that I never thought were possible.

From her special almond flour hummus, to her homemade limoncello. The whole evening was amazing from beginning to end. We arrived at 7:30pm and ended up in deep philosophical conversations up past midnight (4.5hrs).

Honestly, such an amazing incredible story from Saloua and her love and passion for her food shows! Thanks for an unforgettable experience!

5 stars are not enough!! What a wonderful lunchtime experience. We opted for the menu of the day which is incredibly good value for money - embarrassingly so. I had fresh Tunisian flavour sardines followed by a main of wonderfully fresh bass with rice and mushroom sauce; finished off with normandie apple tart. Fabulous! 👌

Saloua is incredibly kind and welcoming, making us feel at home every time we visit. We keep coming back, letting her surprise us with different dishes (there's no set menu). The food is always amazing, the atmosphere is cozy, and the service is warm and friendly. This is our go-to place for special celebrations. It's a completely unique experience, unlike any other restaurant. Thank you, Saloua, for always taking such great care of us-it's truly a pleasure to dine at your restaurant!

places.address: Carrer Soler, 18A, Ponent, 07013 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

places.generalDescription: Lluís Perez Pastisser is an upscale bakery located near Jaime III, offering a delightful array of handcrafted chocolates, biscuits, cakes, and truffles. Renowned for its meticulous attention to detail, this local patisserie also provides delectable lactose-free and gluten-free options. What sets this bakery apart is not only the exquisite flavors but also the elegant packaging. Additionally, Mama Carmen in Palma serves organic breakfast items and delectable pastries.

sources.snippet: Sweeten your day with a mid-morning visit to the exquisite patisserie Lluis Perez in Calle Bonaire, an absolute favourite with our sweet toothed friends. Tea and cake is also a pleasure at Mariola's Bakery, while Sa Bodegueta, also famed for delicious desserts offers a full lunch and supper menu as well. For gelato-lovers, head to Gelateria Pomono and try out their great variety of artisan ice cream and frozen yoghurt.
sources.shortName: Passion in Palma, romantic hotspots for Valentine's Day

places.name: Lluís Perez Pastisser

reviews.text: A small hidden patisserie in the center of Palma. Have been there twice during different visits and was always positively surprised by the quality of the deserts. The strawberry speciality is my favorite and the coffee is a very good accompaniment. Eider is providing very welcoming and warm service.
Chilled coffee shop with some lovely desserts. The pastry on the meringue tart was crisp and buttery! Coffee should have been warmer though.

I visited Luis Pérez and was blown away, the quality, the ingredients, the care in every detail… absolutely top-notch. The shop itself is beautiful and inviting, and every pastry feels like a luxury. A must-visit in Mallorca.

places.address: Carrer de Bonaire, 14, Centre, 07012 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Beatnik & Market Palma is a unique and innovative dining concept created by Five Senses Hospitality, known for their unconventional approach to food and beverage. The restaurant offers indoor and outdoor dining options in a cozy courtyard shaded by palm, fig, and cherry trees. The rooftop bar at Puro Hotel is a trendy spot attracting stylish crowds with its signature cocktails and appetizing tapas. With global influences, Beatnik offers playful and diverse cuisine combinations from Mediterranean, Asian, American, and Latin origins.

sources.snippet: If you are looking for a fun night out as a couple, then Beatnik Restaurant & Bar is the place for you. Discover the most entertaining atmosphere in Palma with exquisite creative fusion cuisine and the best live music.

places.name: Restaurant Beatnik & Market Palma

reviews.text: Nice atmosphere, great service and delicious food! ✨ Great place for date nights! Very romantic and not noisy at all. They had a DJ and it was very nice! We got Sea-bass Risotto and Corvina Thai both were so flavorful! And finished with a light, creamy and delicious cheese cake with a compost of red berries and chocolate crumbs! 😋

We have been staying at the hotel Puro, and checked out it's downstairs restaurant. The food was very delicious (especially the short rib) our chicken was a little dry but all our other dishes were fantastic. Our deserts were amazing- definitely try the snickers one! It was very quiet and peaceful in the restaurant, there was only some quiet background music. We had a lovely evening.

Angelica was an amazing server, who gave us the best recommendations. The ambiance outside was so romantic and the restaurant was very intimate. Our favorite dishes by far were the Tuna sashimi flatbread (!!) and the Seabass risotto. Would come again next time we are in Mallorca!!

places.address: Carrer de Montenegro, 10, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Fundación Bartolomé March is a historic mansion turned modern art museum located in Palma de Mallorca. The stately former residence showcases a diverse collection of art, sculpture, and antique books. The palatial house was once owned by the phenomenally wealthy March family and now houses sculptures by 20th-century greats such as Henry Moore, Auguste Rodin, Barbara Hepworth, and Eduardo Chillida.

sources.snippet: You may like to go inside some of its top historic sites like the Cathedral, the Royal Palace of La Almudaina, the Fundación Bartolomé March, a historic mansion turn modern art museum (somewhat limited collection, but lovely building and views!). Do was wandering on the streets south of the Cathedral, where you can also find the Banys Arabs, the remains of the Arab Baths. One of the most romantic places in Palma, there’s also a pretty garden where you can take a break.
sources.shortName: Romantic Mini-Guide to Mallorca, the Island of Love

places.name: Fundación Bartolomé March

reviews.text:
I would HIGHLY recommend a visit to this wonderful museum and art gallery! The 18th century nativity scenes were breathtaking and intriguing at the same time. Who would've known Naples started the  Christmas nativity traditions??
Salvador Dali's prints were remarkable to me, and they come with an interesting connection to Freud, Egypt, and Moses.
There are great sculptures in the courtyard, a new story about map making, gorgeous historic rooms, photo opportunities of the Cathedral, a wonderful ambience - and toilets! Well worth the entrance money ❤️

A lovely palace. Mr Marsch was a huge collectionist. Many drawings
and paintings from Dali. Several piece of arts from Rodin, Henry Moore. The decoration of the palace deserves it.

Beautiful visit to do, the palace is absolutely magnificient. The interior rooms have been very well kept in their original state with their furnitures, carpets, paintings, maps, and many lithographies from Dali. Sculptures are displayed outside in the courtyard area (one of them from Rodin) and you can admire the beautiful view to the cathedral which is just next door. I recommend visiting this place. Entrance: 10€ for adults, 6€ for children.

places.address: Carrer del Palau Reial, 18, Centre, 07001 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

places.generalDescription: Café la Lonja is a charming wood-beamed tavern with art deco touches and a terrace, offering tapas, filled baguettes, and cocktails. It is located in the heart of a neighborhood that features narrow streets lined with restaurants, cafes, and bars. Nearby attractions include the historic La Lonja building, which was once a fish market in the 15th century.

sources.snippet: Inside our hotel, located in the La Lonja neighbourhood, you will find one of the most romantic restaurants in Mallorca: The Merchants, whose superb menu offers exquisite grilled cuisine, such as grilled seafood and succulent grilled meat.

places.name: Café la Lonja

reviews.text:
Great Cafe in superb location. Amazing buildings all around. The squarenthe outdoor chairs are situated in catches the sun and is sheltered from the wind but with a view of the marina.
The cafe building itself is beautiful and traditional with lots of wood and original features.
Service exceptional. Friendly and efficient. They never stop and are polite and efficient even though there's never an empty seat/table. We saw them operate a turn up queuing reservation system for people that wanted a table. Worked perectly and people had a chance to get a drink and then get a table as aoon as one became free.
The food is excellent. Tasty, plenty of choice, fresh and really tasty. Everything we ordered was great especially the meat stew (gorgeous tender beef),  quiche lortaine, potato omelette (spanish omelette), small tein baguettes and bacon wrapped dates. Was also pleasantly surprised how tasty the draught lager was compared to everywhere else I've had one this week.
Thoroughly recommended.

Very poor service and disorganized staff
We had a very bad experience at Café La Lonja. We asked for a table outside, but the waitress said everything was reserved and that people inside were waiting. We went inside, but the staff told us the outside waitress was in charge. Very confusing and no one seemed to care.

While we waited, we saw people leaving the terrace and others sitting down without any clear order. We ended up waiting over an hour without being helped. During that time, we had 3 beers and 3 wines at the bar.

After all that, the manager told us that if we wanted to eat, we had to leave our seats and wait outside - again! It made no sense and felt very disrespectful.

The place is small, badly managed, and the terrace waitress was rude and unhelpful. The only good thing was the barman, who was kind and polite.

Definitely not worth it. We do not recommend this place

Tourists are expected to be polite and buy something if they want to use the toilets. This  was such a place that we decided to go in to use the toilet when we were at Palma. Though this was a spot we picked at random,  we came out thoroughly impressed.

The cappuccino was one of the best I ever had at a pub. The fresh apple juice that my wife ordered was so fresh and sweet that we ordered another glass. Though the staff didn't know English and the place was filled with locals, the service was really good. Definitely not a tourist trap location.

As we went in at an odd time we weren't hungry enough to order lunch. But I wished we did.

places.address: Carrer de la Llotja, 2, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain

places.generalDescription: StayCatalina Boutique Apartments is a delightful haven nestled on Catalina Island, perfect for travelers seeking a cozy and charming escape. The stylishly designed units come equipped with kitchenettes and inviting terraces, allowing guests to unwind in comfort. This intimate apartment hotel also offers bike rentals, making it easy to explore the vibrant surroundings filled with restaurants, bars, and the lively Mercat Santa Catalina.

sources.snippet: Charming self-catering apartment suites in the heart of the historic quarter. Each has a patio or terrace and decor is fresh, laid back and chic with whitewashed wood, tasteful art with splashes of blue or red, and rustic furniture. Well placed for exploring and ideal for families and couples alike!
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Palma de Mallorca, Spain (2025)

places.name: StayCatalina Boutique Apartments

reviews.text: An amazing stay at Stay Catalina. Apartments are amazing. Clean well laid out, large and spacious and close to Palma old town. Felix is a fantastic friendly host who cannot do enough and the other staff are all amazing. Thank you so much for a memorable first stay in Palma  !!!

We had the 80m2 2 bedroom 2 bathroom appartment on the 2nd floor.
Very nice appartment, good location close to the harbour and only 10 minutes walk from the center, far enough away from all the noise and that for a very reasonable price.
The owner was very helpfull when we asked about restaurants, beaches or how to use the bus.
Thank you Felix.

Amazing experience. The apartments are very well laid out and tastefully decorated, the service is excellent and Felix and the staff are very nice and helpful. Location is great, in a quiet corner of a buzzing neighbourhood. Fully recommended. Thank you very much for a great stay!

places.address: Carrer de Bayarte, 14, Ponent, 07013 Palma, Illes Balears, Spain

places.generalDescription: Arrels by Marga Coll, located at the prestigious Gran Melia de Mar hotel in Palma, offers a delightful and innovative take on traditional Mallorcan cuisine. Renowned Catalan chef Didac Velve and pastry chef Marilo Escobar have successfully captured the hearts of diners with their bold interpretations of regional dishes. The restaurant's breakfast is particularly renowned for its romantic ambiance and stunning sea views.

sources.snippet: Ensconced within the luxurious Gran Meliá de Mar, Arrels is a gourmet’s delight. Offering tasting menus that span five to seven courses, it’s a deep dive into contemporary Mallorcan cuisine. Every dish is a canvas, portraying the island’s gastronomic landscape with a modern twist.
sources.shortName: Celebrating Love In Mallorca: Most Romantic Restaurants To Discover | by Mallorca Magic

places.name: Arrels by Marga Coll

reviews.text: The food and service are incredible! I have to say I normally dislike places with a set menu as it ends up being too lengthy with small portions and lots of „foam” on the plate but this place is different and really worth visiting! The dishes have a proper texture and substance and combined some traditional Mallorca flavours. Service is wonderful! The atmosphere could be a bit warmer but maybe it's because we went there off season and was rather empty.

Good food, but not excellent. Setting and service were really good, but I expected a bit more from the taste of the dishes.
The pumpkin soup was good, the salad and the monkfish rather „boring“. Same as almost all courses and dishes, the starters and mains could have benefited from a bit more pepper, salt, and spices.
It was decorated quite beautiful and the service/ staff was very nice. The price for the 5-course menu itself (56 EUR pp.) was fair, however the Drinks were expensive (Espresso 4.50 EUR).

This was the best restaurant that I have been to in a while. The service was fantastic and the food was absolutely excellent. The Chef goes to the local market every day and sets the menu. It was an absolutely phenomenal experience. I'm so thankful. My husband and I were so impressed and highly recommend this restaurant.

places.address: Hotel de Mar Gran Meliá - The Leading Hotels of the World - Adults only, Paseo de. Mallorca Islas Baleares ES, Passeig Illetes, 7, 07181 Calvià, Spain

places.generalDescription: Sadrassana restaurant is located in a charming 19th-century mansion in the heart of Palma's Old Town. The restaurant shares its space with the Horrach Moya Art Gallery, offering diners a cultural and culinary experience. The traditional interiors have been featured in TV and film, adding to the restaurant's allure. Sadrassana is known for its inventive Balearic-inspired dishes, with the suckling pig and rack of lamb being highly recommended.

sources.snippet: Set in the heart of Palma’s old quarter, Sadrassana effortlessly transports you to a bygone era with its 19th-century manor setting. Each dining space tells tales of history, intertwining them with mouth-watering dishes. From local tapas to the freshest catch of the day, it’s a treat for both the palate and the soul.
sources.shortName: Celebrating Love In Mallorca: Most Romantic Restaurants To Discover | by Mallorca Magic

places.name: Sadrassana restaurant

reviews.text:
Fantastic dinner spot in old town Palma on a wonderful square. Gorgeously renovated space that is so chic and comfortable.
The food was wonderful and they were very accommodating of allergies (well marked menu, plenty of gluten free options).
It reminded us our favorite spot in Cartagena (El Baron).
Gluten free croquettes and cocas were so yummy!

Tasty dinner here, particularly for its gluten free options which were excellent.
GF bread, cocas, croquettes, crispy eggplant all delicious. Slightly quiet atmosphere and seemed to be only tourists.

Absolute delicious and gorgeous way to start our first holiday in Mallorca. We chose the tortilla, some different cocas and ceviche to share and were not disapointed, it was amazing. The wine was carefully matched by the staff to our choices and the decor fresh and stylish. I‘d love to go back!

places.address: Plaça de la Drassana, 15, Distrito Centro, 07012 Palma, Balearic Islands, Spain
